data.title: DATA
questions: In this phase, establish the specific feedback you received.
What exactly was the feedback? What words were used?
What exactly was the feedback? What words were used?
If not sufficiently explicit/detailed, ask for specific examples.
How actionable was the feedback (i.e., what you need to do)?
How clear to you is the behavior/outcome that’s expected?
If not sufficiently clear, ask what specific behaviors are wanted.

data.title: INTERPRETATION
questions: In this phase, explore possible interpretations or misinterpretations.
To what extent did the person interpret/judge your behavior?
To what extent did those interpretations align with your own?
What could have contributed to any misinterpretation?
To what extent did their perception not match your intention?
If not, consider clarifying what your intention was.

data.title: REACTIONS
questions: In this phase, evaluate how the feedback affected you
With what part did you agree? With what did you disagree?
How was the feedback delive#cc2229? Tone, body language?
How did their delivery make you feel?
To what extent did it feel ‘unfair’? No control over?
To what extent were you trigge#cc2229 emotionally?
How is it affecting your self-esteem? Motivation? Morale?
How is it affecting your respect for or rapport with the person?
Consider communicating the impacts to the feedback-giver.
What other reactions did you experience? How are those impacting you still?

data.title: DECISION
questions: In this phase, analyze and conclude how to respond to the feedback.
What are reasons to accept the feedback?
What will likely happen as a result?
What are reasons NOT to accept it? Or even challenge it?
What will likely happen if you do this?
What’s your decision? Based on what rationale?
If ‘accept’, what will you stop doing? Do differently?
If ‘accept’, how will you hold yourself accountable?
If to ‘ignore/challenge’ it, how will you communicate that?

data.title: LEARNING
questions: In this phase, reflect on your deeper insights about the feedback.
What did you learn from this experience?
How will you translate this insight into action?
What does this mean for your further development?
